intro: Noticastrum decumbens, commonly known as the creeping mimosa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing shrub with slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the Mimosaceae family. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple pairs of small, feathery leaflets. Noticastrum decumbens is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
